questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the Show multiple elements as property of a widget?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. On a widget form, use the Show multiple elements as field to set whether multiple elements are shown separately or as an aggregate. 

https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-now-intelligence/page/use/dashboards/concept/multi-element-select-indicator-views.html

The purpose of the "Show multiple elements as" property of a widget is to:

B. Control the presentation of multiple element trends

This property determines how a widget displays data when multiple elements from a breakdown are selected for comparison. It allows for the customization of how these trends are visualized, whether they are shown together in one chart, in separate charts, or in some other comparative format, enhancing the widget's ability to convey information effectively.

questions.question_text: When configuring a Breakdown Source on a Dashboard, how do you ensure that Performance Analytics widgets are filtered correctly?

discussion.content:
When configuring a Breakdown Source on a Dashboard to ensure that Performance Analytics widgets are filtered correctly, you should:

B. For each widget, enable “Follow interactive filter”

This option ensures that the widgets on the dashboard will respond to the selections made through interactive filters, including those from breakdown sources, and update their displayed data accordingly. This feature is crucial for creating interactive and dynamic dashboards where user selections can drive the visualization of data across multiple widgets.

choices.C: Edit each widget and enable “Follow element”
choices.A: Edit each widget and enable “Apply Dashboard Filter”
choices.B: For each widget, enable “Follow interactive filter”
choices.D: For each widget, enable “Act as interactive filter”

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. 1 - Without the matrix, a single level of Breakdowns is collected.

Explanation:
In ServiceNow Performance Analytics (PA), the "Collect breakdown matrix" option determines how many levels of breakdowns can be collected for an Indicator:

If unchecked (as shown in the image), only a single level of breakdown is collected.
If checked, multiple breakdown levels (hierarchical breakdowns) can be collected, enabling more granular analysis.

The correct answer is D. 1 - Without the matrix, a single level of Breakdowns is collected.
When the “Collect breakdown matrix” option is not checked, only a single level of Breakdowns is collected for the Indicator.By default, the interactive breakdown applies as the 1st-level breakdown. However, if the widget is on a breakdown dashboard and Follow element is selected on the Widget form, the interactive breakdown applies as the 2nd-level breakdown. (Collect breakdown matrix must be set on the indicator for 2nd-level breakdowns to apply.) Any breakdown that is set on a dashboard that contains the widget applies as the 1st-level breakdown.
B. There is no limit on the levels of Breakdowns collected.
